'''''Arda Philology 4''''' is the fourth volume of the journal ''[[Arda (annual)|Arda Philology]]'', and contains the proceedings of the Fourth International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages, ''[https://www.omentielva.com/ocantea.htm Omentielva Cantea] ([[Omentielva]])'', which was held in Valencia in August [[2011]].<center>[[Arda Philology 3|Previous Issue]] || [[Arda Philology 5|Next Issue]] </center>

==Contents==
*Foreword
*Contents
*Contributors' Biographies
*Index Locorum
*[[Arden R. Smith]]: "Editing Tolkien's Alphabets"
*[[Georgia Kyte]]: "Mystery and Magic in Distant Lands: The Names of the [[Blue Wizards|Ithryn Luin]] as Clues to Their Role and Importance"
*[[Ivan A. Derzhanski]]: "Some Parallels Between Pronouns in J.R.R. Tolkien's and the Real World's Languages"
*[[Måns Björkman]]: "[[Quenya|Quenya's]] Participles"
*[[Aleksandar Mikić]]: "Of ''orivaine'', ''kamilot'', and Their Kindred: Words for Legumes in Tolkien's Invented Languages"
*[[Arden R. Smith]]: "Phonetic Symbols in Tolkien's Early Alphabetic Materials"
*[[Roman Rausch]]: "Sound Symbolism in Elvish"
*[[Helge Fauskanger]]: "The World's Most Evil Syllable"

==External links==
